content.description: Route 32 on page 319 of A Bouldering Guide to Utah, "start low and follow the weakness veering left up the middle of the face".
content.protection: Couple of crashpads for sure, maybe a spotter too
content.location: Two low chalky crimps are the start then head up into the long sidepull.

content.description:
Looking for a little choss rock followed by some nice granite, well this is the problem for you.

Start sitting with hands in the lowest section in the obvious jug feature. Move up the right arete to a jug topout. The crux is likely height-dependent but don't be deterred.Â  See picture for the intended route.
content.protection: 1 big and a small pad for the rock at your back.
content.location: Just to the Northwest of the Lost boulder. See picture

content.description:
Route 34 on page 319 of A Bouldering Guide to Utah, "climb the juggy arete feature on the right side of the wall".

Great warmup to the area and good practice topping out up high.
content.protection: Maybe a pad, pretty easy to bail on.
content.location: Can start on the same rail as Disappear, then head up to the right along the arete.

content.description: Route 31 on page 319 of A Bouldering Guide to Utah, "climbs the features just to the right of the arete".
content.location: When looking at the boulder, this is to the left of the large tree, just before the leftmost arete.

content.description: Route 33 on page 319 of A Bouldering Guide to Utah, "start low sitting on edges, head straight up over the bulge on edges and crystals".
content.protection: A crashpad, definitely might want a spotter
content.location: Starts just to the right of Thunderstorm, on the large rail.
